title: Drawing, "Elevation of a Stand and Incense Burner", 1775
medium: Pen and brush and black ink, wash, black chalk on white laid paper
provenance:
Léon Decloux as of 1906

H. Destailleur (Sold, Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 114)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Smoke rises from the incense burner on a stand, which is decorated with a fluted band and rosettes, female heads connected by fruit festoons.  A serpent rises from the base of the stand which terminates on ball feet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of a Stand and Incense Burner", 1775.
1775. Pen and brush and black ink, wash, black chalk on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-52.
